channel.title: Need help with my first model
channel.description:
A long while ago, I looked at a sticky tut for modelling. Well, I tried, and this is the crap that followed. I know it sucks, but I am looking for a few tips. Here are some pics of what i've got so far.
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/mug8ev.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/2wbxoqq.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/ab2txy.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/33pd2co.jpg[/img]
As you can see, everything is flat and doesn't look very good. Also, the sword's edge is flat as well. The bottom has no faces on it yet, just lines... I've triangulated everything, but I need to know more to make better models in the future. Also, some coloring tips would be nice :)

item.title: Need help with my first model
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Yeh it was kinda shit tbh, i got confused half way through the middle and had to do a bodge job on the handle, about 3/4 of the way, i remembered it was a tutorial and kinda started to show you what i was actually doing instead of just doing it, and the zooms and angle got messed up because of the movie maker i used, i’ll turn that off next time, also, youtube removed the music.

So overall, epic fail for me.
Lol. Will redo another time, probably today, but i need a different model really.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with my first model

item.title: Need help with my first model
item.dc:creator: @Hellman1 Hellman1
item.description:
@Hellman1 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:7, topic:267124”]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0h3Joiv5-HU

You can have that, it’s kinda not done though.
I’m still writing up the tutorial.
And i’m planning on recording me modeling a more complex model, any ideas?[/quote]

Very nice vid! Helped quite a bit… Showed me a lot of things I didn’t know before. Angles sometmes were al ittle bad, though.

And to get my model to lie flat for easier… How do I do that? In my model above, I had to start in midair and try and make it stay together =\

Read full topic

you can ctrl+j the points on the blade
itll join together u dont have to make it skinny…

item.title: Need help with my first model
item.dc:creator: @Buddy_budster Buddy_budster
item.description:
@Buddy_budster wrote:

Ok i cant really help with the 3d part but for clour try a pink that would be sick of mabye a green or a yellow i havnt seen many of those coulours and i always think they look cool

although a tip try stretching your model so that your pulling it higher and skinnyier then it would almost look like a bandos scimmy… good job so far though
